title: John C. Hull (politician)
summary: John Carpenter Hull (November 1, 1870 – January 7, 1947) served the state of Massachusetts for twenty years between 1916 and 1936 at the  Statehouse in Boston chairing the committees of Education, Judiciary, Elections and Public Institutions. He was also the Speaker of the House of  Massachusetts from 1925-1928, educator, lawyer, and the first Securities Director of Massachusetts.
